title: Physics Terms Quiz
description: Explore the language of physics, from fundamental forces and motion to energy, waves, and the laws governing our universe.

questions.question: What does the term 'inertia' describe?
options: The speed at which an object travels
The tendency of an object to resist changes in its state of motion
The force of gravity on an object
The energy stored in a spring

questions.question: What is 'kinetic energy'?
options: Energy an object possesses due to its motion

questions.question: What does 'entropy' measure in physics?
options: The total energy in a system
The degree of disorder or randomness in a system

questions.question: What is 'friction'?
options: A force that opposes the relative motion of surfaces in contact

questions.question: In physics, what is a 'vector'?
options: A quantity that has both magnitude and direction

questions.question: What does 'refraction' refer to?
options: The bouncing of light off a surface
The bending of light as it passes from one medium to another
The absorption of light by a material

questions.question: What is 'torque'?
options: The speed of a spinning object
A rotational force that tends to cause rotation

questions.question: What does 'wavelength' describe?
options: The distance between successive crests of a wave

questions.question: What is 'momentum'?
options: The energy of a stationary object
The force needed to stop an object
The product of an object's mass and velocity

questions.question: What does 'amplitude' refer to in wave physics?
options: The maximum displacement of a wave from its rest position

questions.question: What is a 'photon'?
options: The nucleus of a hydrogen atom
A particle representing a quantum of light

questions.question: What does 'acceleration' mean?
options: The rate of change of velocity over time
The mass of a moving object
The force applied to an object

questions.question: What is 'potential energy'?
options: Stored energy due to an object's position or condition

questions.question: What is 'diffraction'?
options: The bending and spreading of waves around obstacles or through openings
The conversion of heat to light
Light being absorbed by a surface
